About


Hello, Tech World!


I'm Solomon Zelenko and programming is my craft.

While studying neuroscience, I supported my degree by teaching young children how to code with OpenWorld Learning (OWL). OWL brought applied math, programming, and creative problem solving to disadvantaged children in the Denver Area. And for the instructors who worked with program, the process was life-changing.

As my students matured and overcame challenges, they inspired me. By 2018, I discovered that programming felt the most natural to me. And when grit does not suffice, a discipline needs passion. So I took a chance on myself and revised my career path.

This decision led to a 2 year journey of self, group, and mentored study; 3 portfolio projects; and a new perspective. Today, I write clean code, have the mindset to identify and solve problems, and enjoy the challenges.

When it's time to take a break, you can find me practicing voiceover acting, staying active, and writing.
